seeFretboard.Videos.Audio module¶

class seeFretboard.Videos.Audio.Audio(audioPath)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for working with audio files and MIDI data.

property audioPath¶

Get the audio path.

property sampleRate¶

Get the sample rate.

saveMidi(frames)[source]¶

Convert frames to MIDI and save as a PrettyMIDI object, which would be a MIDI file.

Parameters:

frames (list) – List of frames representing audio data. Each frame contains information about the pitch, start, and end time.

Returns:

The generated MIDI object.

Return type:

pretty_midi.PrettyMIDI

saveSmallWav(out_path, y, fs)[source]¶

Save the audio signal as a WAV file.

Parameters:

  • out_path (str) – The output file path.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – The audio signal.

  • fs (int) – The sample rate.

sonifyJams(frames)[source]¶

Convert frames to MIDI, synthesize audio, and save as a WAV file.

Parameters:

frames (list) – List of frames representing audio data.

Returns:

A tuple containing the synthesized audio signal and the sample rate.

Return type:

tuple

seeFretboard.Videos.Frame module¶

class seeFretboard.Videos.Frame.Frame(frameRate)[source]¶

Bases: object

The Frame class is designed to represent a frame in a video. It stores the frame rate and frame period, which are important parameters for determining the timing and smoothness of the animation. The main functionalities of the class are to set and get the frame rate and frame period, which can be used to control the speed and duration of the video.

Parameters:

frameRate (int or float) – The frame rate of the frame.

frameRate¶

The frame rate of the frame.

Type:

int or float

framePeriod¶

The time duration of each frame in seconds.

Type:

float

Return type:

Returns:

The frame rate of the frame.

Return type:

int or float

setFramePeriod(fp)[source]¶

Sets the time duration of each frame.

Parameters:

fp (float) – The new frame period for the frame in seconds.

setFrameRate(fr)[source]¶

Sets the frame rate of the frame.

Parameters:

fr (int or float) – The new frame rate for the frame.

seeFretboard.Videos.Images module¶

class seeFretboard.Videos.Images.Images[source]¶

Bases: object

The Images class is designed to create and manage image files. It allows the user to set the output path, name, and file type of the image, and automatically generates a file name based on these parameters. The class also includes getter and setter methods for each attribute, allowing for easy modification of the image properties.

outputPathName¶

The output path name where the image will be saved.

Type:

str

name¶

The name of the image.

Type:

seeFretboard.Videos.TabSequence module¶

class seeFretboard.Videos.TabSequence.TabSequence(trackNum=0, frameRate=30, filePath='/Users/lindazhang/Downloads/Drexel/SeniorProject/seeFretboard/seeFretboard/GuitarSet')[source]¶

Bases: Frame

The TabSequence class is responsible for generating sequences of frame from audio files. It uses the GuitarSet dataset to extract note information from audio tracks and converts this information into tablature frames. The class can generate frames in either fret or MIDI format and can convert between the two. It also provides methods for adding tablature frames and converting frames to notes with time information.

addFretFrame(frame)[source]¶

Add a fret frame to the tab sequence.

Parameters:

frame (str or list) – The fret frame to add. If it’s a string, it represents a single frame. If it’s a list, it represents multiple frames.

addMidiFrame(frame)[source]¶

Add a MIDI frame to the tab sequence.

Parameters:

frame (str or list) – The MIDI frame to add. If it’s a string, it represents a single frame. If it’s a list, it represents multiple frames.

addTab(seconds, tab)[source]¶

Add a tab to the tab sequence.

Parameters:

  • seconds (float) – The duration of the tab in seconds.

  • tab (str or list) – The tab to add. If it’s a string, it represents a single frame. If it’s a list, it represents multiple frames.

framesToNotesWithTime()[source]¶

Convert the frames to video notes with time information.

This method populates the notesWithTimeFrames attribute based on the midiFrames attribute. The video notes represent the notes being played along with their start and end times.

makingFrames()[source]¶

Create the frames for the tab sequence based on the string frets or MIDI pitches.

This method populates the fretFrames attribute if the frame type is “fret”, otherwise it populates the midiFrames attribute.

Note: The method assumes that the frets or MIDI pitches have already been initialized.

Parameters:

frameType (str) – The frame type to set, either “fret” or “midi”.

seeFretboard.Videos.Video module¶

class seeFretboard.Videos.Video.Video(startTime, endTime, currentFrame, frameStep, frameRate=30, videoName='defaultVid', fileExtension='.mp4', codec='mp4v', videoWAudioName='defaultVideoWAudio')[source]¶

Bases: Frame

The Video class is designed to represent a video and inherits from the Frame class. It stores information about the video such as the start and end times, current frame, frame step, video name, file extension, codec, and audio name. The main functionalities of the class are to add frames to the video, set and get the video properties, and save the video.

frames¶

A dictionary of frames with their corresponding time frames.

Type:

dict

seeFretboard.Videos.VideoManager module¶

class seeFretboard.Videos.VideoManager.VideoManager(fretboard, video, images, imageProgressBar=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

The VideoManager class provides functionalities to manage video and image files. It allows the user to save video frames as images, generate a video from saved images, create a video with audio, and delete all saved images. It also provides options to display a progress bar while generating images and to set the output file format for images.

fretboard¶

The Fretboard object.

Type:

Fretboard

video¶

The Video object.

Type:

Video

images¶

The Images object.

Type:

Images

imageProgressBar¶

Flag indicating whether to display a progress bar while generating images.

Type:

bool

createVideoWithAudio()[source]¶

Creates a video with audio.

This method combines the video file and audio file into a single video file with audio.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the video or audio files specified in the Video object do not exist.

deleteAllImages()[source]¶

Deletes all saved images.

This method deletes all image files in the output directory specified in the Images object.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the output directory specified in the Images object does not exist.

property imageProgressBar¶

Flag indicating whether to display a progress bar while generating images.

Type:

bool

saveAsVideo()[source]¶

Generates a video from saved images.

This method reads the saved images, orders them based on their filenames, and creates a video from the ordered frames.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the output directory specified in the Images object does not exist.

saveAsVideoImages()[source]¶

Saves video frames as images.

This method iterates over the frames of the video and saves each frame as an image.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the output directory specified in the Images object does not exist.

saveAsVideoImagesNoSeconds()[source]¶

Saves video frames as images when the number of seconds is not defined. For guitarset and other data where number of second is not defined

This method saves video frames as images without considering the number of seconds. It uses a dictionary to track previously saved frames to avoid duplicate saving.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the output directory specified in the Images object does not exist.

saveImage()[source]¶

Saves the fretboard visualization as an image.

This method saves the current state of the fretboard visualization as an image file. The image format is determined by the file extension specified in the Images object. png and svg for now.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the output directory specified in the Images object does not exist.

saveVideoWithAudio()[source]¶

Saves a video with audio.

This method combines the video file and audio file into a single video file with audio and saves it with a specified name.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the video or audio files specified in the Video object do not exist.
